weather_report:
The twilight hours over Downtown San Francisco greet an atmospheric quilt of heavy clouds, a promise of storms unfurling in the night. Rain cascades in rhythmic symphony, accompanied by gusts that’ll conjure whispers through the streets, leaving the air charged with an invigorating energy. The temperature, resting near fifty-three degrees, cloaks the city in a somber embrace that sparks both nostalgia and urgency. With a near-certain promise of continued showers and the low rumble of distant thunder, visibility may be less than ideal. Any fog that may cling to the Golden Gate is likely hidden beneath layers of moisture, rendering the iconic views somewhat obscured.

As the day unfolds, expect the rain to pause momentarily, creating space for a few shy sunbeams, although the coolness will linger, inviting those headed outdoors to bundle themselves in layers against the chill. A sturdy coat, perhaps, along with water-resistant shoes to navigate the puddled sidewalks seems prudent for the brave souls stepping into the exploring heart of the city. Amid this brooding weather, perhaps an afternoon spent meandering through a quiet bookstore or sipping a warm brew while nestled in a café would provide the perfect respite, transforming the inevitable drizzle into a soft backdrop for contemplation and comfort.
